intro: Oreocharis burtii, commonly known as the Burt's oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis burtii is considered a species of conservation concern.
